buoy.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: an object that floats on the sea, a lake etc to mark a safe or dangerous area
buoy.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to make someone feel happier or more confident
buoy.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The party is buoyed up by the latest opinion poll results.
buoy.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to keep profits, prices etc at a high level
buoy.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Increased demand for computers buoyed their profits.
buoy.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: if the market or prices are buoyed, people feel confident and buy stocks and shares, and prices rise
buoy.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: In Britain, bond prices were buoyed by a rise in the pound.
The market was buoyed by gains in some large telecommunications shares.
